snippet: Universities are embracing lucrative deals with dining contractors to help pay for campus improvements, but critics say students often pay for them in the rising costs of meal plans.
abstract: Colleges nationwide are dealing with private dining contractors who offer commissions and signing bonuses to help pay for campus improvements, agreements that often pass steep dining fees onto students; programs are part of new model of raising money through private vendors in absence of state funding.
lead_paragraph: Universities are embracing lucrative deals with dining contractors to help pay for campus improvements, but critics say students often pay for them in the rising costs of meal plans.

headline.main: Meal Plan Costs Tick Upward as Students Pay for More Than Food
headline.print_headline: Colleges Pile Renovation Costs Onto the Plates of Students
